name: fractiously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows you are upset or annoyed: The waiting room was full; a child cried fractiously. At the beginning of the film we see a couple fractiously preparing to entertain a group of friends.
More examplesFewer examplesThe child kicked off her sheet fractiously; her usually pale face was red.He has fractiously maintained that he is against war, and hopes his tour next week will be a mission of peace. A team of filmmakers is fractiously attempting to finalize a documentary in the studio.
